selection_reasoning: Selected top 3 performers (force-directed, scipy optimization, gradient descent) for their strong results, plus simulated annealing for diversity in search strategy, and one more global optimizer for its potential to escape local minima. These 5 trials represent different optimization paradigms that can be refined and hybridized in the next generation.

trial_selections.reasoning: Best score of 2.5569, closest to target 2.635. Uses force-directed layout which is a promising physics-based approach that can be refined with better force parameters and longer simulation time.

Second best score of 2.5198 with scipy optimization approach. Optimization-based methods have strong theoretical foundations and can be improved with better initial conditions and constraint formulations.
Third best score of 2.4785 using gradient descent. Gradient-based methods are complementary to other optimization approaches and can be hybridized with global search methods.

Score of 2.3932 with simulated annealing. This global optimization method explores the solution space differently than gradient methods and has potential for improvement with better cooling schedules and perturbation strategies.

Score of 2.2077, likely using basin hopping or another global optimizer. Even though lower scoring, global optimization methods can escape local minima and might find better solutions with parameter tuning.
